vpc.overview.title: Workers VPC
vpc.overview.subtitle: Connect to services and APIs in your external private networks using Cloudflare Tunnels and VPC Services
vpc.tunnels.columns.name: Name
vpc.tunnels.emptyState.title: You have no Tunnels
vpc.tunnels.emptyState.description: Create a Tunnel within your external private network to connect it to Cloudflare. This is needed to connect to external services in the private network from Workers using VPC Services.
vpc.createTunnel.title: Create a Tunnel
vpc.createTunnel.description: Start by creating a Tunnel to connect your private network to Cloudflare. Then, you will be able to create a VPC Service for each service in the private network in which your Tunnel is running.
vpc.createTunnel.form.tunnelName.label: Tunnel name
vpc.createTunnel.form.tunnelName.require: A unique name for your Tunnel
vpc.createTunnel.operatingSystem.label: Operating System
vpc.createTunnel.operatingSystem.setupDe: Choose your operating system to get installation instructions.
vpc.createTunnel.architecture.label: Architecture
vpc.createTunnel.installation.title: Install and Run
vpc.createTunnel.installation.descriptio: Run the following commands to install and connect your Tunnel.
vpc.createTunnel.security.title: Security Notice
vpc.createTunnel.security.description: This token grants access to your account. Keep it secure and don't share it.
vpc.createTunnel.connection.title: Connection Status
vpc.createTunnel.connection.description: Waiting for your Tunnel to connect...
vpc.createTunnel.connection.successDescr: Your Tunnel is now ready to use.
vpc.createTunnel.connection.instruction: Make sure to run the installation commands above.
vpc.privateNetworkServices.columns.name: Name
vpc.privateNetworkServices.emptyState.de: Create a new VPC Service to get started. You will need the Tunnel that connects your external private network, the host or IP address, and the port of your external service.
vpc.createService.title: Create a VPC Service
vpc.createService.description: Connect to a service in a private network in an external cloud or on-premises by creating a VPC Service.
vpc.createService.form.serviceName.label: Service name
vpc.createService.form.serviceName.requi: A unique name for your service (can be changed later)
vpc.createService.form.tunnel.label: Tunnel
vpc.createService.form.tunnel.required: Select a Tunnel to connect this service through your private network.
vpc.createService.form.tunnel.validation: No tunnels available. Please create a Tunnel first.
vpc.createService.form.host.label: Host or IP address
vpc.createService.form.host.required: The hostname, IPv4 or IPv6 address of your service (e.g., api.example.com, 192.168.1.100)
vpc.createService.form.port.label: Port (optional)
vpc.createService.form.port.required: The port your service listens on (defaults to 80 and 443 for HTTP/HTTPS)
vpc.createService.form.serviceName.toolt: A unique identifier for your service configuration that you'll use to reference this service (this can be renamed after creation).
vpc.createService.form.tunnel.tooltip: The Cloudflare Tunnel that connects your private network to Cloudflare. This Tunnel must be active to route traffic.
vpc.createService.form.host.tooltip: The hostname, IPv4, or IPv6 address of the service in your private network (e.g., api.example.com, 192.168.1.100).
vpc.createService.form.port.tooltip: The port number where your service is listening. Defaults to port 80 for HTTP services and 443 for HTTPS services if not specified.
vpc.createTunnel.form.tunnelName.tooltip: A unique name for your Tunnel that will appear in the Cloudflare dashboard and CLI tools.
vpc.createTunnel.operatingSystem.tooltip: Select the operating system where you'll install and run the cloudflared daemon.
vpc.createTunnel.architecture.tooltip: Select the CPU architecture of your system. Most modern systems use 64-bit architecture.
